verses.name: Philemon 1:1
verses.text: Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother,

verses.name: Philemon 1:2
verses.text: To Philemon our dear friend and fellow worker, to Apphia our sister, to Archippus our fellow soldier and to the church that meets in your home:

verses.name: Philemon 1:3
verses.text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Philemon 1:4
verses.text: I always thank my God as I remember you in my prayers,

verses.name: Philemon 1:5
verses.text: because I hear about your faith in the Lord Jesus and your love for all the saints.

verses.name: Philemon 1:6
verses.text: I pray that you may be active in sharing your faith, so that you will have a full understanding of every good thing we have in Christ.

verses.name: Philemon 1:7
verses.text: Your love has given me great joy and encouragement, because you, brother, have refreshed the hearts of the saints.

verses.name: Philemon 1:8
verses.text: Therefore, although in Christ I could be bold and order you to do what you ought to do,

verses.name: Philemon 1:9
verses.text: yet I appeal to you on the basis of love. I then, as Paul--an old man and now also a prisoner of Christ Jesus--

verses.name: Philemon 1:10
verses.text: I appeal to you for my son Onesimus, who became my son while I was in chains.

verses.name: Philemon 1:11
verses.text: Formerly he was useless to you, but now he has become useful both to you and to me.

verses.name: Philemon 1:12
verses.text: I am sending him--who is my very heart--back to you.

verses.name: Philemon 1:13
verses.text: I would have liked to keep him with me so that he could take your place in helping me while I am in chains for the gospel.

verses.name: Philemon 1:14
verses.text: But I did not want to do anything without your consent, so that any favor you do will be spontaneous and not forced.

verses.name: Philemon 1:15
verses.text: Perhaps the reason he was separated from you for a little while was that you might have him back for good--

verses.name: Philemon 1:16
verses.text: no longer as a slave, but better than a slave, as a dear brother. He is very dear to me but even dearer to you, both as a man and as a brother in the Lord.

verses.name: Philemon 1:17
verses.text: So if you consider me a partner, welcome him as you would welcome me.

verses.name: Philemon 1:18
verses.text: If he has done you any wrong or owes you anything, charge it to me.

verses.name: Philemon 1:19
verses.text: I, Paul, am writing this with my own hand. I will pay it back--not to mention that you owe me your very self.

verses.name: Philemon 1:20
verses.text: I do wish, brother, that I may have some benefit from you in the Lord; refresh my heart in Christ.

verses.name: Philemon 1:21
verses.text: Confident of your obedience, I write to you, knowing that you will do even more than I ask.

verses.name: Philemon 1:22
verses.text: And one thing more: Prepare a guest room for me, because I hope to be restored to you in answer to your prayers.

verses.name: Philemon 1:23
verses.text: Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, sends you greetings.

verses.name: Philemon 1:24
verses.text: And so do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas and Luke, my fellow workers.

verses.name: Philemon 1:25
verses.text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
